RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia Eletronica pela Universidade de So Paulo (1988), mestrado em Foundations of Advanced Information Technology - Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine (1990) e doutorado em PhD in Computing - Imperial College of Science and Technology, University of London (1994). Foi professor visitante em departamentos de Cincia da Computao na Universite Paul Sabatier - Toulouse (2011) e na Cornell University (2012-2013). Atualmente professor titular da Universidade de So Paulo. editor das revistas: South American Journal of Logic, So Paulo Journal of Mathematical Sciences e editor convidado da Theoretical Computer Science e da Anals of Mathematics in Artificial Intelligence. Tem experincia na rea de Cincia da Computao, com nfase em Lgica, Raciocnio Lgico-Probabilstico, Lingustica Computacional, e tem atuado como pesquisador principal nos seguintes temas: logica, inteligncia artificial, Humanidades Digitais e linguistica computacional.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Marcelo Finger has a BSc in Electronic Engineering from Universidade de So Paulo (EP-USP 1988), MSc in Foundations of Advanced Information Technology from the Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine (1990) and PhD in Computing from Imperial College of Science and Technology, University of London (1994). He ha held visiting positions in departments of Computer Science at Universite Paul Sabatier - Toulouse (2011) and Cornell University (2012-2013). He is currentely Professor of Computer Sciece at the Department of Computer Science, Institute of Mathematics and Statistics at the University of So Paulo. He is part of the editorial board of the following journals: South American Journal of Logic, So Paulo Journal of Mathematical Sciences and has been a guest editor at Theoretical Computer Science and Anals of Mathematics in Artificial Intelligence. He as been acting as an expert in the Computer Sciece, focusing on Logics and Dedecutive-Probabilistic Reasoning, acting as a researcher in the following subjects: logic, artificial intelligence, Digital Humanities and computational linguistics.

Membro do Dirigente Comit Especial de Inteligncia Artificial da Sociedade Brasileira de Computao (CEIA-SBC), dese 2009.
Vice-diretor do Centro de Competncia em Software Livre, do Instituto de Matemtica e Estatstica da USP, desde dezembro de 2008.
